entry.value: Fire mages' favourite weapon - a ball of liquid fire that explodes if it hits an enemy. Just remember - move away or you might be burnt too...
Battle mages' favourite weapon - a bolt of liquid fire that burns hit enemies.

A magic rune defining your skills in sanguine spells. The more skilled in this rune you are the more powerful are your spells combining uncornern, verbosity, sensitivity, vigor and leadership. Also by increasing this skill your character /todo/ will regenerate hit-points a little bit faster. //serce, krew//

A magic rune defining your skills in phlegmatic spells. The more skilled in this rune you are the more powerful are your spells combining gentleness, passivity, conciliatory, caution and solemnity. Also by increasing this skill your character /todo/ will have greater poison resistance by a little bit. //mozg, sluz//

A magic rune defining your skills in melancholic spells. The more skilled in this rune you are the more powerful are your spells combining reflectance, restraint, peace, stiffness and apathy. Also by increasing this skill your character /todo/ will regain mana little bit faster. //sledziona, czarna zolc//

A magic rune defining your skills in choleric spells. The more skilled in this rune you are the more powerful are your spells combining explosiveness, agression, variability, impulseviness and activity. Also by increasing this ability your character will be /todo/ moving a little bit faster. //watroba, zolc//
Your mana capabilities. Defines your maximal magic storage. Each point increases it by 10%.

Your physical health. Defines your endurance, hit-points and overall regeneration.
Each point gives you additional 20% hit-points limit.
A lightning that jumps between enemies, dealing less damage with each jump.
An intimidating set of lightning bolts targetting many enemies at once.
Increases chance that electricity spells will stun the target.
Basic electricity spell. Inflicts small damage and has a chance to stun the target.
A direct extension of the "Wandering electron" spell. The difference in the electric potentials between the target and it's nearest environment causes a temporary transition of electric charges.
Sends a bomb that draws nearby enemies into a vortex of electricity, dealing damage and keeping them in check.
Multiple lightning bolts shot in the directions of several separate targets.
Laser beam with very long range and superior penetration, burning everything on its way.
A single lightning bolt which deals massive damage to a single enemy.
The battlemage summons a magical storm, creating an unstoppable mass of lightning bolts. Even if someone manages to dogde the storm, they will be catched by wandering electrons.
Chain of lightning bolts draining life from enemies.
Even while running away, a battlemage is dangerous to his foes. As long as the player's the spell holding key, the mage leaves a trail of blazing footprints which hurt all enemies who step on them.
The ultimate solution for the "being surrounded by a horde of ferocious mosters" problem.

Although a lot of mages despise this spell, because of it's close relationship to necromancy, it's very useful in some situations - corpses of recently killed monsters explode, damaging nearby enemies. The longer the player hold's the spell key, the more corpses explode.
Each level of this skill increases chance that fire bullets will explode, dealing additional damage within a wider area.
This skill represents the ability of using fire magic - each level decreases mana cost of fire spells by 20%.
A simple fire arrow, dealing damage and knocking enemies backward. This arrow can fly through enemies, so you can hit a few monsters in a row.
Fire mages' favourite weapon - a ball of liquid fire that explodes if it hits an enemy. Just remember - move away or you might be burnt...
When you get surrounded, this ability is what you need. Enemies around you are pushed away by a hot wave - you might get a moment to run.
The mage summons two pits full of molten fire and sulphur. They appear in front of the mage, and any bypassing monster is captured and burned for a certain period of time.

This spell creates a barrier of impenetrable flame, which hurts monsters (and careless battlemages), preventing them from passing through. Only the most desperated enemies can make it to the other side, but they will pay dearly for it.
A firey melee attack, strongly pushing nearby enemies away. Effective when they're starting to surround you...

A powerful defensive spell, increasing elemental resistances and attacking any monsters trying to chew on the caster. Additionally, the mage is surrounded by a cloud of sparks, further separating the mage from his enemies.
Thanks to this skill, the mage improves his ability to set a monster on fire and deal additional damage. The flames can spread to the nearest monsters.
A continuous stream of tiny sparks. Good against nests and single opponents, but you risk getting surrounded easily.
The higher level of this abillity, the greater the chance that the "Explosion" spell will spead additional missiles of pure fire, damaging even more foes.
Fire magic taken to the extreme - this spell spreads a wide fan of sparks, dealing damage to any monsters within it's limited range.
Visibly increases the mage's speed for a short while.
A truly frightening weapon - a spinning disc of acid spreading poisonous rain.
A rather strong healing spell, but it takes a while before it's done.
Your wounds slowly regenerate by themselves.
Flo-kajwerc, a foreigner from the exotic East, was known for two things: a weakness for tabac and a magic rune which increases a wide variety of caster's defensive abilities.

When the Troll shaman, Kromad the Terrifying, lost his bone club in the midst of a battle, he decided to smack enemies with pure magic energy. The spell became interesting enough for human mages to make a copy of it.

Swarm of blades of pure shadow surrounds targets, hitting through them and ignoring all armor. Master d'Apac called it "his greatest achievement" - especially since the first few tests blew several holes in the lab's wall.
Ice mages have many spells which slow down and freeze enemies. This particular spell is very effective when you get surrounded by enemy hordes.

When two mages go together on an adventure, their magic powers become interwoven. They can use it to strengthen each other - and this spell-chant, made by the renowned bard Sothyr, takes advantage of this fact.

Not many spells remained from the books of the cursed necromancer Roxtede, but one is still in use - this is a particularly vicious curse which permanently poisons enemies and reduces their defensive abilities.
Summon a few friendly healing spirits.
Special training allows you to cast spells faster.
Mental focusing allows you to cast your next spell with increased power (level will be temporarily increase by "Overcharging" level / 2).
Your spells now are stronger, thanks to years of training.

This spell was discovered by Siolan, a junior third class battlemage, while he was running away from hordes of mountain trolls. It's quite simple - the more monsters are near the caster, the stronger the caster is pushed away, giving him a fair chance to run away. Battlemages despise this spell, calling it a "coward's trick" - on the other hand, Siolan was one of the few battlemages who lived to the retirement age...
A true mage learns to cast spells using his very life force, not caring for his wounds.
Your experience in magic increases range of your missiles.
A sphere that throws lightning bolts at nearby victims.
Your magic training allows you to obtain mana from environment at an increased rate.
